topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bf181d6368721315b80800#post_54bf181d6368721315b80800
[bq="HJSDGCE"]I will never play horror games alone.
Ever.

I was traumatized from a game I played when I was a kid. It scared me so much that I had nightmares for 3 days straight. Now, I easily get frightened by games.[/bq]
I am still afraid of playing the first and third game of Resident Evil.
Fuck, I'm still afraid of the intro of RE3...
topics.author: 5239db6da4c72d22d9000358

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bf181d6368721315b80800#post_54bf181d6368721315b80800
I kinda wish I could get scared by horror games again. Usually I just start to kind of figure out how the enemy AI works and aside from being mildly startled on occasion, most horror games just become sort of irritating. 

I think something that was like a horror version of no man's sky could get me back into it. Basically have every single thing be randomly generated so there's no way to predict anything.
